properties.title: Melati - Java SQL Website Development Engine
properties.author: Tim Pizey
properties.keywords: Persistence, Java, SQL, Database, Templates, Object Relational Mapping, Objects, Object Oriented, J2EE replacement

section.name: Download Current Snapshot
section.p: The latest snapshot build can be found in our Maven Two repository ( or our Maven One repository).

section.name: CVS Access
section.p: Melati is available via anonymous CVS, which also has a web interface.

With the command-line CVS client, you do:
$ cvs -d :pserver:anonymous@melati.org:/usr/cvsroot login (Logging in to anonymous@melati.org) CVS password: anonymous $ cvs -d :pserver:anonymous@melati.org:/usr/cvsroot checkout melati
You will need a CVS client to perform the above procedure. Every Linux distribution comes with command line CVS.
If you are using Eclipse then you can just point to the above repository and checkout as project.
If you want a Windows CVS client, check out www.tortoisecvs.org
